TopicTitle: Apogee LU-22 Light Utility Shuttle. Kerbin - LKO transfer vehicle

Articles.Content: Looks awesome, nice job. That looks cozy in there, with the cabin and seats.
Holy Jeebus, that thing looks awesome, also, i like the cabin design, it gives it fantastic Kerbal carrying capacity for the size
That is awesome! Ill have to try this out soon
subscribed again, another great ship from Mulbin and Apogee
Try it in FAR
U perfected it! Gj.
Wondering what you used for the borders...

Wondering what you used for the borders...

10 years experience as a graphic designer ... and Adobe Illustrator
How does this thing land? With such small wings, I would think it would simply crash into the ground!

How does this thing land? With such small wings, I would think it would simply crash into the ground!

it actually has a lot of lift, try it for yourself! You can land with the engines completely off in an emergency
can it drop from 120km fully fueled, land, and make it back up to dock at 120km?

can it drop from 120km fully fueled, land, and make it back up to dock at 120km?

In theory yes.... but bear in mind it has a few concealed/clipped tanks so selecting them to refuel in orbit might be difficult. A fuel transfer mod would make it easier to refuel

Tried this out earlier and it was really neat. It looks like a lifting body which is pretty cool - would you consider it to be one? Also, just one quick-fire question: do you use the part clipping feature from the debug menu, or just take advantage of allowed placements with the default settings?

10 years experience as a graphic designer ... and Adobe Illustrator

Beautiful Job... Also, I remember you saying your British somewhere, it'd be cool if you made some British themed ships

Lovely!

For a while, I thought you had attached the passenger seats to radial decouplers, but no, they're just batteries.

Much safer...

Another awesome craft by Mulbin!

Tried this out earlier and it was really neat. It looks like a lifting body which is pretty cool - would you consider it to be one? Also, just one quick-fire question: do you use the part clipping feature from the debug menu, or just take advantage of allowed placements with the default settings?

I guess it is as the lift surfaces are mostly in the body of the craft. I tend to turn clipping on these days as it saves a lot of time. You could make most of my craft without the clipping setting but would spend a lot of time tricking the editor for exactly the same result.

Beautiful Job... Also, I remember you saying your British somewhere, it'd be cool if you made some British themed ships

Technically any fictional craft by apogee is british by design As for historical or real wolrd replicas we really haven't made much on our own. Black knight etc.... and I suppose I could make a copy of beagle to crash into duna!

Thanks for the reply. If you want another idea for a British ship you could try Skylon, have you heard of that? It's pretty cool, but looks really hard to replicate. Could make a fun challenge but also be frustrating because of the shape of the vehicle.

Edited November 23, 2013 by Woopert

Thanks for the reply. If you want another idea for a British ship you could try Skylon, have you heard of that? It's pretty cool, but looks really hard to replicate. Could make a fun challenge but also be frustrating because of the shape of the vehicle.

or you could try it's little brother: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Reaction_Engines_A2

Technically any fictional craft by apogee is british by design As for historical or real wolrd replicas we really haven't made much on our own. Black knight etc.... and I suppose I could make a copy of beagle to crash into duna!

Good lord man! Beagle 1 didn't crash, it... Lithobreaked.
Link to craft file please? Or is it on the spaceport?

Link to craft file please? Or is it on the spaceport?

Click the blue box that says "Click here to download!"

Even though it may not look like a button, it is.

It's like a version of my Dropship! Except mine is bigger and more stupid looking. Kudos to your cute, efficient and small design!
Just gave this a quick test run and seems to still be working ok in the current version of KSP...
Sorry to necro this but im going to give it a try to see if it still works
